pull.title: Make WalletInitInterface and DummyWalletInit private, fix nullptr deref
pull.body: Implementations of `WalletInitInterface` don't have to be public, so make them private. This makes the interface instantiation static. Also reduces `ENABLE_WALLET` usage and removes the unnecessary `src/wallet/init.h` header.

events.body: This change fixes the nullpointer dereference here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10762#commitcomment-28345993
Tested ACK 57c00059bb51be64a670edebc00416fc2050d5f1 once this has been rebased on master to fix the linter error.

rename.to: Make WalletInitInterface and DummyWalletInit private, fix nullptr deref

events.message: wallet: Make WalletInitInterface and DummyWalletInit private
wallet: Refactor to WalletInitInterface* const g_wallet_init_interface

events.body:
Tested ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12836/commits/d894894aab78dbd5e32267313237648933248377

For both `--enable-wallet` and `--disable-wallet`:
  - [x] Ran `bitcoin-qt -h`
  - [x] Verified preexisting wallet data loaded

Tested ACK d894894aab78dbd5e32267313237648933248377

Did the same as @jamesob and manually added in logging to `DummyWalletInit`'s `Open()` to see that it is being used with `--disable-wallet` and not being used with `--enable-wallet`

comments.body:
typo `dymmy`.

Why does this need to be static?
Dummy typo 😄It doesn't have to be static. IMO these can have internal linkage. WDYT?

>  IMO these can have internal linkage. WDYT?

Yes, seems reasonable.
What's the reason for moving this class from `src/walletinitinterface.h`?
I think the idea is to narrow the scope of this class to where it's needed and reduce unnecessary header bloat.
